Egg prices are flying high, and Waffle House is scrambling with a new surcharge. 

Waffle House is adding a 50-cent surcharge per egg due to soaring egg prices and shortages caused by bird flu.

Rather than raising menu prices, the Georgia-based chain is rolling out a temporary surcharge as the cost of eggs continues to climb. The U.S. Department of Agriculture predicts egg prices will rise 20% this year.

The bird flu outbreak has led to the slaughter of millions of egg-laying hens, contributing to the shortage.

Man sentenced to 475 years for dog fighting in Paulding County

PAULDING COUNTY, GEORGIA - A Paulding County Superior Court judge sentenced a man to 475 years in prison for more than 100 dog fighting and animal cruelty charges.

Raid on Vincent Burrell's home

The backstory: In November 2022, investigators raided the property of Vincent Burrell.

Paulding County Assistant District Attorney and lead prosecutor on the case, K.C. Pagnotta, was there at the scene from day one of the investigation. "Everywhere you looked, you couldn't take a step in any one direction without there being another pit bull staked out on a chain. And the purpose of doing that is dog fighting. They will put the pit bull out on a chain, and they space each dog out enough that they can see each other. They can agitate each other, but they can actually get to one another. And it's part of the building of aggression that they used to train fighting dogs," Pagnotta said.

She says all the dogs were malnourished and living in deplorable conditions. This included young Baby Shark, one of the dogs rescued from the property. "She looks a lot better now, but if you can see, there's kind of her limbs come out and an angle, both of her front legs. That's because she developed rickets from poor nutrition, and also, the crate she was in was entirely too small. So, she wasn't able to stretch her legs and straighten them out like she's supposed to. And she actually had to have a series of casts on her front legs," Pagnotta said.

Historic dog fighting sentence

Dig deeper: On Monday, Burrell went to trial facing 93 counts of dog fighting and 10 counts of cruelty to animals. After a four-day trial, the jury found Burrell guilty on all counts. On Thursday, Paulding County Superior Court Judge Dean Bucci handed down the maximum sentence of 475 years in prison.  "I kind of lost my breath a little bit," Pagnotta said when she heard the sentence.

She says it could possibly be the longest prison term for this type of offense in the nation’s history.  "It's extremely rare. I was actually assisted in prosecuting this case by Jessica Rock. She works for the Prosecuting Attorney's Council of Georgia, and she's actually their animal resource prosecutor. So, she travels around the state helping counties, helping aides like myself prosecute these cases. And she also prosecutes animal fighting cases federally. And so, in talking with her, as far as she knows, this is the longest sentence for dog fighting that anyone has ever been given at the state or federal level," Pagnotta said.

What they're saying: Paulding County District Attorney Robert Lane says it sends a very clear message from his office. "If you come to Paulding County and you engage in evil acts, we are going to make an example out of you," he said. 

Fighting animal cruelty in Georgia

Local perspective: Pagnotta says this case had been hidden in plain sight for years. "My house isn't far from where the defendant lived. And the fact that he was able to operate this many dogs basically under our noses, it was shocking because the scene in his backyard was like nothing I could have ever imagined," she said.

She says this case is going to change that going forward by helping them identify similar operations. "We know what we're looking for now. And I think that's going to help in any further cases we have that may include serious animal cruelty or dog fighting," Pagnotta said.

She also said going forward they can now coordinate more easily with other agencies.

In this case, she worked with the state’s Prosecuting Attorneys Council, the Paulding County Sheriff’s Office, and Marshals as well as special agents with the U.S. Department of Agriculture. 

How to help end dog fighting

What you can do: The Paulding County DA’s office says the original tip came in from an Amazon driver, which highlights how important the concept of "see something, say something" is. 

Source: https://www.fox5atlanta.com/news/man-sentenced-475-years-dog-fighting-paulding-county

The Georgia Department of Agriculture announced all poultry activities in the state are suspended after the bird flu was confirmed.

The Georgia Department of Agriculture has suspended all poultry activities in the state following the detection of Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza (HPAI) at a commercial facility. This case, identified by the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service in Elbert County, marks the first occurrence of HPAI in a commercial operation in Georgia since the nationwide outbreak began in 2022. As a result, all poultry exhibitions, shows, swaps, meets, and sales are halted until further notice. Georgia Agriculture Commissioner Tyler Harper emphasized the serious threat this poses to the state's poultry industry and its economic impact on residents. The infected facility reported signs of Avian Influenza on January 15; samples were collected for testing on January 16 and confirmed later that day. Emergency teams have been deployed to manage depopulation and sanitation efforts at the site housing approximately 45,000 broiler breeders. All commercial operations within a 6.2-mile radius are now under quarantine with surveillance testing for at least two weeks. However, an upcoming major poultry expo in Atlanta can proceed as planned since no live birds will be present there

January 18, 2025 (Saturday)

Shortly before midnight last night, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) published its initial findings from a study it undertook last July when it asked eight large companies to turn over information about the data they collect about consumers, product sales, and how the surveillance the companies used affected consumer prices. The FTC focused on the middlemen hired by retailers. Those middlemen use algorithms to tweak and target prices to different markets.

The initial findings of the FTC using data from six of the eight companies show that those prices are not static. Middlemen can target prices to individuals using their location, browsing patterns, shopping history, and even the way they move a mouse over a webpage. They can also use that information to show higher-priced products first in web searches. The FTC found that the intermediaries—the middlemen—worked with at least 250 retailers.

“Initial staff findings show that retailers frequently use people’s personal information to set targeted, tailored prices for goods and services—from a person's location and demographics, down to their mouse movements on a webpage,” said FTC chair Lina Khan. “The FTC should continue to investigate surveillance pricing practices because Americans deserve to know how their private data is being used to set the prices they pay and whether firms are charging different people different prices for the same good or service.”

The FTC has asked for public comment on consumers’ experience with surveillance pricing.

FTC commissioner Andrew N. Ferguson, whom Trump has tapped to chair the commission in his incoming administration, dissented from the report. 

Matt Stoller of the nonprofit American Economic Liberties Project, which is working “to address today’s crisis of concentrated economic power,” wrote that “[t]he antitrust enforcers (Lina Khan et al) went full Tony Montana on big business this week before Trump people took over.” 

Stoller made a list. The FTC sued John Deere “for generating $6 billion by prohibiting farmers from being able to repair their own equipment,” released a report showing that pharmacy benefit managers had “inflated prices for specialty pharmaceuticals by more than $7 billion,” “sued corporate landlord Greystar, which owns 800,000 apartments, for misleading renters on junk fees,” and “forced health care private equity powerhouse Welsh Carson to stop monopolization of the anesthesia market.” 

It sued Pepsi for conspiring to give Walmart exclusive discounts that made prices higher at smaller stores, “​​[l]eft a roadmap for parties who are worried about consolidation in AI by big tech by revealing a host of interlinked relationships among Google, Amazon and Microsoft and Anthropic and OpenAI,” said gig workers can’t be sued for antitrust violations when they try to organize, and forced game developer Cognosphere to pay a $20 million fine for marketing loot boxes to teens under 16 that hid the real costs and misled the teens.  

The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau “sued Capital One for cheating consumers out of $2 billion by misleading consumers over savings accounts,” Stoller continued. It “forced Cash App purveyor Block…to give $120 million in refunds for fostering fraud on its platform and then refusing to offer customer support to affected consumers,” “sued Experian for refusing to give consumers a way to correct errors in credit reports,” ordered Equifax to pay $15 million to a victims’ fund for “failing to properly investigate errors on credit reports,” and ordered “Honda Finance to pay $12.8 million for reporting inaccurate information that smeared the credit reports of Honda and Acura drivers.”

The Antitrust Division of the Department of Justice sued “seven giant corporate landlords for rent-fixing, using the software and consulting firm RealPage,” Stoller went on. It “sued $600 billion private equity titan KKR for systemically misleading the government on more than a dozen acquisitions.”

“Honorary mention goes to [Secretary Pete Buttigieg] at the Department of Transportation for suing Southwest and fining Frontier for ‘chronically delayed flights,’” Stoller concluded. He added more results to the list in his newsletter BIG.

Meanwhile, last night, while the leaders in the cryptocurrency industry were at a ball in honor of President-elect Trump’s inauguration, Trump launched his own cryptocurrency. By morning he appeared to have made more than $25 billion, at least on paper. According to Eric Lipton at the New York Times, “ethics experts assailed [the business] as a blatant effort to cash in on the office he is about to occupy again.”

Adav Noti, executive director of the nonprofit Campaign Legal Center, told Lipton: “It is literally cashing in on the presidency—creating a financial instrument so people can transfer money to the president’s family in connection with his office. It is beyond unprecedented.” Cryptocurrency leaders worried that just as their industry seems on the verge of becoming mainstream, Trump’s obvious cashing-in would hurt its reputation. Venture capitalist Nick Tomaino posted: “Trump owning 80 percent and timing launch hours before inauguration is predatory and many will likely get hurt by it.”

Yesterday the European Commission, which is the executive arm of the European Union, asked X, the social media company owned by Trump-adjacent billionaire Elon Musk, to hand over internal documents about the company’s algorithms that give far-right posts and politicians more visibility than other political groups. The European Union has been investigating X since December 2023 out of concerns about how it deals with the spread of disinformation and illegal content. The European Union’s Digital Services Act regulates online platforms to prevent illegal and harmful activities, as well as the spread of disinformation. 

Today in Washington, D.C., the National Mall was filled with thousands of people voicing their opposition to President-elect Trump and his policies. Online speculation has been rampant that Trump moved his inauguration indoors to avoid visual comparisons between today’s protesters and inaugural attendees. Brutally cold weather also descended on President Barack Obama’s 2009 inauguration, but a sea of attendees nonetheless filled the National Mall. 

Trump has always understood the importance of visuals and has worked hard to project an image of an invincible leader. Moving the inauguration indoors takes away that image, though, and people who have spent thousands of dollars to travel to the capital to see his inauguration are now unhappy to discover they will be limited to watching his motorcade drive by them. On social media, one user posted: “MAGA doesn’t realize the symbolism of [Trump] moving the inauguration inside: The billionaires, millionaires and oligarchs will be at his side, while his loyal followers are left outside in the cold. Welcome to the next 4+ years.” 

Trump is not as good at governing as he is at performance: his approach to crises is to blame Democrats for them. But he is about to take office with majorities in the House of Representatives and the Senate, putting responsibility for governance firmly into his hands. 

Right off the bat, he has at least two major problems at hand. 

Last night, Commissioner Tyler Harper of the Georgia Department of Agriculture suspended all “poultry exhibitions, shows, swaps, meets, and sales” until further notice after officials found Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza, or bird flu, in a commercial flock. As birds die from the disease or are culled to prevent its spread, the cost of eggs is rising—just as Trump, who vowed to reduce grocery prices, takes office. 

There have been 67 confirmed cases of the bird flu in the U.S. among humans who have caught the disease from birds. Most cases in humans are mild, but public health officials are watching the virus with concern because bird flu variants are unpredictable. On Friday, outgoing Health and Human Services secretary Xavier Becerra announced $590 million in funding to Moderna to help speed up production of a vaccine that covers the bird flu. Juliana Kim of NPR explained that this funding comes on top of $176 million that Health and Human Services awarded to Moderna last July.  

The second major problem is financial. On Friday, Secretary of the Treasury Janet Yellen wrote to congressional leaders to warn them that the Treasury would hit the debt ceiling on January 21 and be forced to begin using extraordinary measures in order to pay outstanding obligations and prevent defaulting on the national debt. Those measures mean the Treasury will stop paying into certain federal retirement accounts as required by law, expecting to make up that difference later.

Yellen reminded congressional leaders: “The debt limit does not authorize new spending, but it creates a risk that the federal government might not be able to finance its existing legal obligations that Congresses and Presidents of both parties have made in the past.” She added, “I respectfully urge Congress to act promptly to protect the full faith and credit of the United States.”

Both the avian flu and the limits of the debt ceiling must be managed, and managed quickly, and solutions will require expertise and political skill. 

Rather than offering their solutions to these problems, the Trump team leaked that it intended to begin mass deportations on Tuesday morning in Chicago, choosing that city because it has large numbers of immigrants and because Trump’s people have been fighting with Chicago mayor Brandon Johnson, a Democrat. Michelle Hackman, Joe Barrett, and Paul Kiernan of the Wall Street Journal, who broke the story, reported that Trump’s people had prepared to amplify their efforts with the help of right-wing media.

But once the news leaked of the plan and undermined the “shock and awe” the administration wanted, Trump’s “border czar” Tom Homan said the team was reconsidering it.

Translation with my notes in bold and in [brackets]ExcerptsThanks for reading Don’s Substack! Subscribe for free to receive new posts and support my work.SubscribeAnd America's main problem is the dollar.Emmanuel Todd’s book: The Defeat of the WestThe dollar is ruining AmericaIn economics, there is a term "the curse of natural resources", which means a situation when their abundance in the country and export abroad hinder the development of other sectors of the economy. [This is what happened to Holland, which once exported large amounts of gas and oil, but when the deposits dwindled, the country initially had very little industry to fall back on. This economic problem became known as the “Dutch disease.” Holland has recovered since]https://tsargrad.tv/articles/prokljate-ameriki-nuland-i-blinken-mstjat-ukraine-za-svoih-dedushek_1111987Vladlen ChertinovThe Curse of America: Nuland and Blinken Take Revenge on Ukraine for Their GrandfathersThe war in Ukraine is bringing the end of America closer. This is the conclusion made by the French scientist and prophet Emmanuel Todd. He once accurately predicted the collapse of the USSR, the global financial crisis of 2008 and the "Arab Spring", and last year he wrote the book "The Defeat of the West" [La défaite de l’occident], which caused shock in the West. In his research, Todd paints a portrait of the United States as an incurably sick country. Having forgotten how to work and think, suffering from violence and obesity, becoming poorer and going crazy. And it all began in 2015 - when God was abolished in the United States. Since then, America, and along with it, its servants around the world, have been sucked into a "black hole".Sick CountryEmmanuel Todd is surprised that there are still many people who believe in the power of America. And in its democracy. They believe that in the conflict with Russia, it defends freedom and human rights. Although the facts say otherwise.Emanuel Todd predicted the collapse of the USSR, and now predicts the defeat of the West.The United States is a sick country with an increasing infant mortality rate, which in 2020 was 5.4 per 1,000 births (for comparison: in Russia it was 4.4).The average life expectancy in the United States is also declining: from 78.8 years in 2014 to 77.3 years in 2020 and 76.3 in 2021. While in Russia, "still bearing the biological imprint of its tortured history," it grew by six years from 2002 to 2020 — from 65.1 to 71.3 years.But the most striking thing is that the rise in mortality in the United States was accompanied by the highest healthcare costs in the world — in 2020, they accounted for 18.8% of the country's GDP. The paradox is explained simply: part of this spending went... to the destruction of the population by pharmaceutical companies. No other country in the world takes so many drugs. With a population of 5% of all the inhabitants of the planet, Americans buy more than 50% of all drugs produced, some of which are the same drugs.The most rapidly "dying" part of the American population were white people aged 45-54 — residents of the internal "Republican" states. The reasons: alcoholism, suicide and drug addiction. They also became the main victims of the opioid scandal. Todd explains its essence:Large pharmaceutical companies, through the mediation of highly paid and unscrupulous doctors, provided patients suffering morally for economic and social reasons with dangerous painkillers that are addictive, very often leading to direct death, alcoholism or suicide.This can be compared to the destruction of excess population, disappointed with their lives, and with the economic and social situation in the country.In 2016, Congress, led by the pharmaceutical lobby, prohibited health authorities from suspending the use of "medicinal opioids", passing a law allowing the US pharmaceutical industry to continue killing its citizens.The United States is also the absolute leader in the world in mass shootings of some citizens by others and in the number of prisoners. Todd ironically remarks that in the "freest country", defending democracy from Russian "autocracy", more people are behind bars than anywhere else in the world.In 2019, the number of prisoners per million inhabitants in the United States was 531 people, compared to 300 in Russia. And I believe that by recruiting mercenaries in prisons, the Wagner Group had to lower this number.There is also such an indicator as the average duration of effective work. In 1961, it was 40 hours a week in the United States, and in 2003 - only 27.Todd also draws attention to the fact that America is getting dumber. Studies show a decline in intelligence between 2006 and 2018. This applies to both good and bad students from all ethnic groups.Between the two world wars, secondary school education was actively developing in America. As a result, by 1945, half of the world's industry was in the United States. After the war, it was the turn of universities, and a boom in higher education began. But after 1965, something went wrong.The US has a dual SAT system, one part assessing verbal skills, the other math skills. They deteriorated equally from 1965 to 1980. Then, until 2005, there was stabilization. Then the decline resumed. The level of industrial production was also falling. By 2019, it was already 16.8% of the world's. In 2020, only 7.2% of American students received an engineering education. For comparison: in Russia - 23.4%. With half the population (146 versus 330 million), our country [the author is Russian] managed to train significantly more engineers than America..As Engels and Lenin predicted, free trade corrupts, but we can add: absolute free trade corrupts absolutely... Neither Engels nor Lenin could have imagined that the Western proletariat could be completely transformed into commoners, living mainly on the labor of the Chinese and other peoples of the world. The transfer of many manufacturing plants abroad contributed to the increasing exhaustion of our provinces and suburbs, turning the productive citizen into a parasitic plebeian, who hardly wants to return to the right path in his heart.The life of a parasitic plebeian is tragic. Todd writes that American workers, realizing their declining social usefulness, turn to alcoholism and drugs, commit suicide, or vote for Trump. And American youth are becoming less and less willing to work and study.Jews are declining along with AmericaThe share of white Americans in higher education in the United States is declining. They are underrepresented even at the most prestigious universities that allow one to join the elite. Todd uses Harvard, Yale and Princeton as examples. While whites make up 61% of the population in the US, they make up only 46% at these three universities. Also less than it could be, based on the composition of the population, blacks and Hispanics.Asians demonstrate the greatest thirst for knowledge. With a total of 6% of the US population, they make up 28% at these three universities! Todd explains this by the fact that the children of immigrants from Japan, Korea, China and Vietnam were protected from the general American "shipwreck" for one or two generations by the still-existing family values ​​and Confucian tradition, for which education was almost sacred.Even Jews are drowning in the American quagmire. Among Harvard students, their number has decreased from 25% to less than 10%. And in the eight most prestigious universities (the so-called Ivy League), Jews make up only 7% - less than the quota that was once introduced for them. [US universities once had a legal quota for Jews]Todd cites an article from 2023 in the book, whose author, analyzing the "catastrophic" state of Jewry in the United States, notes:In academic circles in Hollywood, Washington, and even New York, wherever American Jews have managed to establish themselves, their influence has sharply weakened.For example, with a total share of Jews of 1.7% of the entire US population, they used to make up 20% of federal judges, but now only 7%. Among scientists born between 1944 and 1967, their share was 21%, but among current scientists under 30 - only 4%.If this were to happen in Russia, our government would have long been accused of state anti-Semitism! In the US, of course, there can be no talk of any persecution of Jews: in 2010, according to the Forbes rating, they made up 30% of the top hundred richest people in the country - that same oligarchic elite. Jews are simply deteriorating along with America.But Emmanuel Todd, by the way, emphasizing his own Jewish roots, draws attention to an interesting nuance. Despite the fact that in the US the number of Jews is greatly declining in all their traditional spheres of activity, there are a lot of them in the Biden administration, especially among those involved in foreign policy.For example, on the Board of Directors of the most prestigious foreign policy think tank - the Council on Foreign Relations: almost a third of its 34 members are Jews... In the current ruling group, and especially in the faction engaged in war, Americans of Jewish origin are still overrepresented, says Todd. Moreover, these are not just Jews, but people whose ancestors came from Tsarist Russia and its outskirts. The scientist points to the two most influential figures who, in his words, "run" Ukraine - Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Assistant Secretary of State Victoria Nuland.It turns out that Blinken's paternal grandfather was born in Kyiv. In Victoria Nuland's paternal house, we see a combination of Moldovan and Ukrainian Jews... The fact that so many people in the top geopolitical establishment have family ties to the western part of the former Tsarist empire cannot but worry, Todd concludes. [Western Ukraine has always been a hotbed of Neonazism, and, ironically, Jews were and are heavily represented among this end of the political spectrum. For example, Zelensky is Jewish but seems not to care the Ukrainian folk hero Stepan Bandera once killed about 100,000 Jews in Lvov. Bandera’s birthday is an official celebration in Ukraine]It is clear that the goal of this [US State Department] establishment is the demographic exhaustion of Russia. But it is also clear that the price for this exhaustion will be the destruction of Ukraine. Todd believes that American Jews of Ukrainian descent have no attachment to Ukraine - a country where their ancestors were subjected to anti-Semitic persecution. And he comes close to the question: are the descendants of the once persecuted Ukrainian Jews, "together with the Kyiv government managing this slaughter," taking revenge in such a sophisticated way on the country "that caused so much suffering to their ancestors"?[In this context, let me recommend the article: How Jewish is the war on Russia?]If so, then this is some kind of Old Testament vengefulness.The "Titanic" can no longer turn backThe war in Ukraine has exposed the weaknesses of the United States. Todd notes, by the way, that the nature of the military actions is absolutely consistent with American parasitic globalism:We forced workers in low-wage countries to produce what we needed; we forced Ukraine, a country where the human body is cheap, to wage the war we needed.But America was unable to even wage such a parasitic war. It turned out that the United States is not capable of producing the weapons that Ukraine needs.The strengths of the American economy are information technology and oil and gas: Silicon Valley and Texas. And the rest of the industry is in decline. The war revealed the inability of the United States to produce the required number of shells, missiles and other weapons. In 2022, Russia's GDP was only 8.8% of the US GDP. How, despite this imbalance in their favor, did the United States get to the point where they can no longer produce enough shells for Ukraine? - Todd asks. And so he answers:The U.S. gross domestic product is overwhelmingly made up of services to people whose effectiveness or even usefulness is not always discernible: doctors (sometimes murderers, as we saw with opioids), overrated lawyers, predatory financiers, prison guards, drug enforcement agents, intelligence agencies. In 2020, the GDP even included as value-added the labor of the country's 15,140 economists - the "high priests of lies" with an average annual salary of $121,000. What is U.S. GDP worth if you separate it from the activities of this parasitic mass?Todd compares U.S. GDP to the Nobel Prize in economics - a rattle given to comedians. He argues that American GDP - $76,000 per capita in 2022 - is only 20% consistent with the "physical" sectors: industry, construction, transport, agriculture (by the way, grain production in the US fell from 65 million tons in 1980 to 47 million in 2022 and is teetering on the brink of deficit, while in Russia it grew from 37 million in 2012 to 104 million in 2023). That 20% of $76,000 translates into $15,200, or slightly more than Russia’s GDP ($10,420 in 2024).The drama of the American oligarchy is that it rules a decaying and largely fictitious economy, Todd believes.In the 1980s, the U.S. defense industry employed 3.2 million people; today, it employs only 1.1 million. Modern warfare is technological; most officers in the military should essentially be engineers. But there is an acute shortage of them.The brain drain to law and business schools threatens U.S. military might. Todd writes that war cannot be won by sending injunctions to the enemy or blocking his accounts. But that is exactly what America does. Imposing sanctions, freezing the assets of the Bank of Russia, seizing the property of Russians, refusing to insure ships— Emmanuel Todd has the feeling that the American side is waging war with lawyers, and Ukraine is short of ammunition.The scientist believes that the American ship can no longer be turned around. The Titanic is doomed to sail toward its iceberg. The point of no return was America's rejection of God. However, Todd, as a scientist, does not operate with this concept. He discusses the rejection of Christianity and even specifically Protestantism, on the principles of which America was founded. Its strengths were the cultivation of hard work and a desire for education in people.America and EmptinessFrom 1945 to 1965, America was ruled by a homogeneous, united elite that preserved the best qualities of Protestantism. It, like the rest of the population, obeyed the general morality, and conducted a responsible foreign policy aimed at protecting freedom. But then there was a breakdown in morality - the Anglo-American sexual revolution and the French May of 1968.[May 68 (French : Mai 68) refers to a period of civil unrest that occurred throughout France from May to June 1968. Beginning in May 1968, a period of civil unrest occurred throughout France, lasting seven weeks and punctuated by demonstrations, general strikes, and the occupation of universities and factories. At the height of events the economy of France came to a halt. – Wikipedia]Since then, Protestantism, which for centuries had been the engine of America's economic power, has been slowly dying. [Evangelicalism, based on a peculiar doctrine that deviates from Jesus’ peace and love teachings, has also taken a Zionist turn that is supporting Netanyahu’s genocide]Religious decay has led to the disappearance of social morality and sense of belonging to society. The ruling elite of the world's largest power no longer determines its actions and decisions in accordance with higher values. Today, it is nothing more than a gathering of people completely devoid of common moral principles. The very principle of keeping commitments has become something outdated and negative. Betrayal has become the norm. The complete disappearance of the Christian substrate explains the disintegration of the ruling classes of America.This ultimately led to global upheavals in the world. Emmanuel Todd characterizes the 2000s as the period of the actual end of Christianity in the West. He calls 2015 the year of zero religion, when same-sex marriages were legalized at the federal level in the United States.The scientist calls this an irreversible cultural shift, because homosexuality is condemned by all world religions. But the state of zero religion is not the end. Having crossed zero, America went into the minus and is going further and further along the path of denying reality. The road of lies.The United States, together with England, was the driving force behind a whole chain of revolutions - liberal, sexual, and then "gender", which, having begun with the fight for gender equality, ended with the fight for the freedom of transgender people.Genetics tells us that it is impossible to turn a man (XY chromosomes) into a woman (XX chromosomes) and vice versa. To pretend that this is not so means to state a lie, says Todd.Denial of reality and the fight against it has become central to America. In everything - from transgender people to the economy and the conflict with Russia. For the upper classes of the USA, the need to affirm the false, to worship it and to impose it as truth on society has become predominant. They lie like they breathe.Todd writes that a cult of lies has begun to be established in America. He does not operate with the concept of "the devil". But if we call things by their proper names, then what is happening is pure Satanism. According to the definition of Jesus Christ, the devil is the "father of lies". Having betrayed God, Americans inevitably began to serve Satan.The greatest illusion of these upheavals was the belief that the individual will become greater when freed from the collective. The opposite is true. A person can be great only in and through the community. Alone, he is doomed by his nature to shrink. Now that we are freeing ourselves en masse from metaphysical beliefs, we experience emptiness and shrink in size; this is how Todd described the mechanism of the crisis of the West.The end of the union of madmenThe USA is the world champion not only in the number of prisoners in prisons, but also in the number of obese people. From 2000 to 2020, the number of overweight residents there increased from 30.5% to 41.9% of the total population. Excess weight is a risk factor for many diseases, such as COVID. But obesity, according to Todd, is not only a medical problem, but also an indicator of the mental state of society.In a society where, despite inequality, it is not difficult to feed oneself, obesity indicates a lack of self-control (especially among the rich who can afford quality food) and a violation of the superego on a societal scale.In other words, the obesity of Americans is one of the signs of America's inadequacy. And from inadequacy it is not far to mental disorders.70% of all Americans are on prescription drugs (including 15% of high school students who abuse them), and someone in America dies from an accidental overdose every 19 minutes. 30 million, or almost 10% of the population, regularly take antidepressants, among them every fourth is a woman aged 40 to 60. Antidepressants are one of the causes of suicide and the increasing number of mass shootings.The superego is broken in all of America. Its separation from reality has gone too far. One of the key moments of this separation was the US victory in the Cold War. But Russia became the bone on which America slipped.At first, after the collapse of the USSR, the US did not know what to do with us. Todd writes that in the minds of Americans, Russia ceased to exist as an autonomous player, became a subordinate partner whose fate had yet to be determined. But Russia fell very quickly and in 1994-1998 it hit rock bottom. It lost the First Chechen War. After the default of 1998, its GDP reached a minimum. And this weakness, according to Todd, led America to the decision to deliver the final knockout blow. Since 1999, the United States has entered a state of arrogance. For the first time in its history, it no longer had an enemy. Overwhelmed by this emptiness, it lost its mind. This year, NATO began to expand eastward. That year, NATO bombed Serbia. That year, the American military budget began to increase again after the end of the Cold War. And the United States was close to taking control of Russia's mineral wealth through oligarchs like Khodorkovsky under its control.But in 1999, what Emmanuel Todd calls the irony of history happened: Vladimir Putin came to power in Russia. The country began to recover, and the rise was as fast as the fall. So fast that the United States, blinded by its own arrogance, did not immediately react to it. Moreover, as Todd writes, they considered themselves so invincible that they made another strategic mistake: in December 2001, they forced China to join the WTO, which would undermine their economy.Meanwhile, the Second Chechen War showed that Russia was not going to disintegrate, and Putin’s removal of the oligarchs from power and the arrest of Khodorkovsky [by Russia] in 2003, who was associated with Exxon Mobil, meant the failure of the United States’ attempt to get its hands on our oil and gas industry.In 2007, at the Munich Security Conference, Putin finally broke free - he gave a speech in which he declared that Russia would not accept the American unipolar world. In response, in early 2008, Georgia and Ukraine were invited to join NATO, in full accordance with the precepts of the Russophobe Brzezinski, who believed that the only way to finish off Russia was to amputate Ukraine. Todd calls this the apogee of American arrogance. And then, according to him, the Gods blinded America:[Putin's 2007 Munich speech. You will understand why he was never invited back]The United States began to dig a trap from which they will no longer be able to escape... There is no Russian factor destabilizing the world balance. There is an incurable crisis of the West, the peripheral waves of which have crashed onto the breakwater of resistance - Russia.The West is self-destructing, and its defeat is certain for Todd. The original values ​​that made America strong - Christianity, morality, work ethic and a sense of responsibility - have evaporated. And this is irreversible. The economic decline seems to be irreversible too.America produces almost nothing anymore. It has destroyed its own working class. But it has also lost its ruling class. Todd believes America no longer knows where it is going, it makes decisions in a distorted consciousness based on a distorted vision.These decisions have ceased to be rational and moral. The war in Ukraine is the result of the merger of two madnesses - American and Ukrainian. As a result, the Ukrainian people will die a martyr's death, and the Americans will see the fall of their empire.The defeat for the United States will be the de-dollarization of the world, the cessation of imports and great poverty. The loss of control over its external resources will lead to a decline in the standard of living of the population, which is already low.Already today, many Americans cannot afford to rent housing. Working full time and receiving a salary, they live on the street - in their cars or in tents. And it will be even worse.Emmanuel Todd believes that if there are still real Protestants left in the United States, then, observing what is happening to their country, they will probably often repeat the words of Jesus Christ "fall from grace." They mean that one who stood on the righteous path but strayed from it cannot be saved.[https://www.bing.com/videos/riverview/relatedvideo?&q=California+Tent+Cities&&mid=9F697F6671E17803DFFE9F697F6671E17803DFFE&&FORM=VRDGAR]**Our thanks to AN for this:"He [Starmer] shows more interest and concern for Ukraine than for the people of his country, especially our armed forces." Don't forget too that he said he would rather be at the World Economic Forum in Davos than in Westminster.https://news-pravda.com/world/2025/01/12/971851.htmlhttps://news-pravda.com/world/2025/01/12/971858.html**Here’s your air strike update for Jan 12, 2025Search phrases for those who want to do their own research:EN phrase for translation: Jan 12, 2025, russian missiles, drones, bombs hit UkraineTranslated into RU: 12 января, 2025, российские ракеты, беспилотники, бомбы поражают УкраинуGoogle translate:https://translate.google.com/?sl=auto&tl=en&op=translateTo optimize results, searches must be done in Yandex searchhttps://ya.ru/Translation with my notes in bold and in [brackets]https://lenta.ru/news/2024/12/13/vs-rossii-nanesli-massirovannyy-udar-iskanderami-i-kinzhalami-po-ukraine-minimum-120-raket-vypustili-po-tselyam/?ysclid=m5uksbqv2723501718911:45, 13 December 2024Russia launched a massive strike with Iskanders and Kinzhals on Ukraine. Among the targets is a military airfield in Kyiv[Both the Iskander and the Kinzhal are hypersonic]Rogov reported a massive missile strike by the Russian Armed Forces on UkraineAlina GoncharovaAlina Goncharova (editor of the operational information department)This morning, the Russian Armed Forces launched massive strikes on military facilities and energy infrastructure in Ukraine. The start of the strike was announced by the chairman of the commission of the Public Chamber of the Russian Federation on sovereignty issues, co-chairman of the coordinating council for the integration of new regions Vladimir Rogov.The strike has been carried out since five in the morning. According to Mash, a total of 120 missiles have been launched. According to available data, the Russian army used Iskanders, Gerans and Kinzhals. Explosions were heard in Kyiv, Ivano-Frankivsk, Kharkov, Odessa, Vinnytsia, Cherkasy and other regions of Ukraine. In Kyiv and other regions, emergency power outages began amid missile strikes. Energy Minister German Galushchenko said that the energy system of the entire Ukraine is under threat, three stages of power outages have been introduced, and there may be no power for up to 12 hours. The head of the Lviv regional military administration, Maksym Kozitsky, also reported on strikes on energy facilities in the region.Among the targets is a military airfield in KyivThe Russian Armed Forces have preliminarily launched strikes in the direction of an airfield in Kyiv, where F-16 fighter pilots are trained. Explosions were also heard in the area of ​​a drone manufacturing and helicopter repair plant in the suburbs of Boryspil. There was also a report of a possible strike on an airfield in Chuguev, Kharkiv region.Among other things, the coordinator of the pro-Russian Mykolaiv resistance, Sergei Lebedev, said that the strike was likely carried out on the port in Odessa. The city's mayor, Gennady Trukhanov, reported explosions amid an air raid alert. The Russian army also struck a military airfield in Starokostiantyniv in the Khmelnytsky region, presumably hitting an underground warehouse. Lebedev, citing resistance from Starokostiantyniv, said that "the explosion felt very powerful, it was felt in houses on the other side of the city." Despite regular strikes on the airfield, the Ukrainian military continues to use it. One of the targets could also be a military unit of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the Nikolaev region. "It looks like a military unit on Bugskikh, but the Martynovsky airfield also looks like it," the underground reported.Thanks for reading Don’s Substack! The positive case of the virus, known as H5N1 Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza, was confirmed in a flock of 13 chickens and ducks in Clayton County by the Georgia Department of Agriculture and the U.S. Department of Agriculture.

The Georgia Department of Agriculture announced it had detected a case of Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza, sometimes called bird flu, in a small, backyard flock of chickens and ducks in Clayton County. Via content partner @GeorgiaRecorder
https://t.co/W4plNJCRED
The illness is a highly contagious viral disease that can decimate flocks of birds, both domestic and wild

A positive case of highly contagious bird flu has been found in Clayton County, the Georgia Department of Agriculture and the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service confirmed Friday.

PORTLAND, Ore.—An Oregon house cat died after eating pet food that tested positive for bird flu, Oregon authorities said, prompting a recall of raw frozen pet food that was sold nationwide.

Northwest Naturals, a pet food company based in Portland, Oregon, said Tuesday it had voluntarily recalled one batch of its two-pound Feline Turkey Recipe raw frozen pet food after it tested positive for the virus. The product was sold through distributors in Arizona, California, Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Maryland, Michigan, Minnesota, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, and Wisconsin, as well as Canada’s British Columbia.

“We are confident that this cat contracted H5N1 by eating the Northwest Naturals raw and frozen pet food,” Oregon Department of Agriculture State Veterinarian Dr. Ryan Scholz said in a Tuesday news release. “This cat was strictly an indoor cat; it was not exposed to the virus in its environment, and results from the genome sequencing confirmed that the virus recovered from the raw pet food and infected cat were exact matches to each other.”

Read the article on The Epoch Times

Today, I supported passage of the 2025 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) which establishes the budget and programs that make up the U.S. Defense Department and covers everything from developing and procuring the weapons and armor that America’s armed forces use to paying the salaries of its troops. The bill includes a 14.5% pay raise for junior enlisted members. 

I also supported passage of the Water Resources Development Act (WRDA) of 2024. WRDA is not only crucial to maintaining America’s vital waterways, but it will also create jobs. The projects supported help keep our communities safe, boost local economies by making our waterways more accessible to Georgians and visitors from across the country, and ensure our ports – like the Port of Savannah – remain thriving gateways of commerce and trade for Georgia’s businesses, including our agriculture industry.

“The whole point of the law was protecting the public. Consumers are able to see what’s legal and illegal, and businesses are testing for that,” said Katherine Russell, director of policy for the Georgia Department of Agriculture. “Whenever you’re dealing with an emerging industry, it’s all new and it takes a while to figure out.”

“The whole point of the law was protecting the public. Consumers are able to see what’s legal and illegal, and businesses are testing for that,” said Katherine Russell, director of policy for the Georgia Department of Agriculture. “Whenever you’re dealing with an emerging industry, it’s all new and it takes a while to figure out.”

A policy adviser to Trump during his first term in office, Rollins is the president of the American First Policy Institute, a conservative think tank she co-founded in 2021 that has proposed plans for the president-elect’s second and final term in the White House.

CNN  —  President-elect Donald Trump on Saturday announced one of his former policy advisers, Brooke Rollins, as his pick for secretary of the Department of Agriculture. “Brooke’s commitment to support the American Farmer, defense of American Food Self-Sufficiency, and the restoration of Agriculture-dependent American Small Towns is second to none,” Trump said in a statement. CNN reported earlier Saturday that Trump was expected to pick Rollins, after initially being poised to offer the post to businesswoman and former Georgia Sen. Kelly Loeffler. CNN reported Friday that Trump was poised to offer the post to businesswoman and former Georgia Sen. Kelly Loeffler, who met with the president-elect at Mar-a-Lago on Friday afternoon. There had been several discussions between Loeffler and the transition team regarding the position. But Trump held off from announcing his Agriculture pick as he issued a slew of others Friday night, raising questions about whether Loeffler was ultimately offered the post. Tracking Trump’s picks for his Cabinet and administration Rollins is the CEO of the America First Policy Institute, a group with close ties to Trump’s transition team, and has been a vocal supporter of the president-elect. She congratulated Trump following his election win earlier this month, saying in a post on X, “We love you, Mr. President, and we are so proud to continue the battle for an America built around your America First vision.” Rollins’ name had previously been floated as a potential White House chief of staff. But Rollins stood down after it became clear that seeking the role would amount to a serious power struggle with Susie Wiles, who was ultimately named for the position. Rollins told the transition team that Agriculture secretary would be another role she would be interested in, one source familiar said. Trump and Rollins spoke this week about the role. “As our next Secretary of Agriculture, Brooke will spearhead the effort to protect American Farmers, who are truly the backbone of our Country,” Trump said in his statement Saturday. “Congratulations Brook!” In Trump’s first term, Rollins served as White House Domestic Policy Council director. Before that, she was president of the Texas Public Policy Foundation, a conservative think tank, for 15 years. President-elect Donald Trump is anticipated to nominate former Georgia Senator Kelly Loeffler as the next Secretary of Agriculture. According to CNN, Trump plans to meet with Loeffler at his Mar-a-Lago estate in West Palm Beach, Florida, on Friday afternoon. Loeffler has been a significant fundraiser for Trump's 2024 re-election campaign and serves as a co-chair of his inauguration committee. The Department of Agriculture oversees laws related to agriculture, forestry, food, nutrition, and rural development. CNN's Kaitlan Collins noted that this position will be closely watched due to RFK Jr.'s intention to influence the agriculture sector and Trump's commitment to mass deportations. At a recent rally in Madison Square Garden, Trump stated he would allow RFK Jr. considerable freedom regarding health and food policies. Loeffler was appointed to the Senate by Georgia Governor Brian Kemp in 2019 and served on the Senate Agriculture Committee during her tenure. She has expressed her background growing up on a family farm and understands the challenges faced by farmers due to regulations. Although she won the Republican primary for her Senate seat in 2020, she lost a runoff election in 2021 against Democrat Raphael Warnock. In addition to Loeffler's nomination, Trump also announced Pam Bondi as his choice for Attorney General; other key cabinet positions remain unfilled

I applaud the Biden-Harris Administration's decision to direct the U.S. Department of Agriculture to help farmers who grow fruits, vegetables, and nuts overcome market barriers for their products, and help producers access necessary pre-market storage for their crops following severe weather events, including recent hurricanes.

Georgia’s specialty crop growers are helping feed America – and the world – with the highest quality and affordable produce and nuts. They do so in the face of many challenges, including unfairly priced imports and market volatility due to extreme weather events and natural disasters. This commitment by the Administration is a monumental investment that will help protect our specialty crop growers for years to come.

Specifically, the new Marketing Assistance for Specialty Crops initiative will provide $2 billion to assist specialty crop growers in maintaining a strong domestic supply and expanding market opportunities for their crops. USDA anticipates applications will open in December 2024. Read my full press release below to learn more about this initiative.

A viral invasive fly has made its way to the Peach State, and state officials are asking you to kill them.

If you haven't already seen on social media, many users have recorded videos of them capturing the invasive Spotted Lanternfly in a water bottle in an effort to kill it. 

Officials with the Georgia Department of Agriculture (GDA) said that the species is a "serious threat to the state's No. 1 industry (agricultural industry)." The first spotting in Georgia was made in Fulton County on Oct. 22.

George Ervin "Sonny" Perdue III[1] (born December 20, 1946) is an American politician and businessman who served as the 31st United States secretary of agriculture from 2017 to 2021.[2] A member of the Republican Party, he previously served as the 81st governor of Georgiafrom 2003 to 2011 and as a member of the Georgia State Senate from 1991 to 2002.

Let’s rally together to support them and keep Georgia’s agriculture thriving. Learn more and donate here: www.SupportGeorgiaFarmers.org

Last Friday, the Food Bank hosted a Stakeholder Engagement Roundtable that brought together officials from U.S. Department of Agriculture, Golden Harvest Food Bank, Feeding Georgia, Southeast Regional Cooperative, Clayton County Public Schools, Antioch Urban  Ministries Inc., Margie's House, Cascade United Methodist Church, and First African Community Development Corporation to address the issue of food insecurity affecting thousands of families in Metro Atlanta. The discussion covered key topics such as school nutrition, emergency food assistance, and the role of disaster response in ensuring communities receive the food they need during crises. This kind of collaboration between state agencies, nonprofits, and government entities is essential in building stronger, more resilient food systems. We’re incredibly thankful to everyone who participated and look forward to continued efforts to make healthy food accessible for all.

The Georgia Department of Human Services is beginning our Disaster SNAP (food stamps) efforts. D-SNAP provides temporary food assistance in the form of a one-time payment to low-to-moderate income households who lost income or sustained property damage following a disaster. Ware, Charleton, Brantley, Camden, Glynn, and McIntosh counties are a part of “Phase 2” which will begin Tuesday, October 29th . 

Site name:  Hours of operation: Dates: Address: Counties served:

Brantley, Camden, Charlton, Glynn, and McIntosh: Evergreen Missionary Baptist Church 8 a.m.-5 p.m. Oct. 29-Nov. 4, 2024 (excluding Nov. 3, 2024) 1365 Kinlaw Rd. Woodbine, GA 31569 

Atkinson, Bacon, Ben Hill, Clinch, Coffee, Irwin, Pierce, and Ware: 
Young’s Chapel Missionary Baptist Church 8 a.m.-5 p.m. Oct. 29-Nov. 4, 2024 (excluding Nov. 3, 2024) 710 Shirley Ave.
Douglas, GA 31533 

Press Release:
Georgia Implements Phase 2 of Disaster SNAP in Atkinson, Bacon, Ben Hill, Berrien, Brantley, Brooks, Camden, Charlton, Clinch, Coffee, Colquitt, Cook, Echols, Glynn, Irwin, Lanier, Lowndes, McIntosh, Pierce, Thomas, Tift, and Ware Counties

Affected Residents in These Counties may Pre-register Through D-SNAP Portal Beginning Oct. 26

Atlanta, GA – Georgians in areas hit hardest by Hurricane Helene can pre-register for assistance to feed their families under a temporary program called the Disaster Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (D-SNAP) supported by the Georgia Department of Human Services’ (DHS) Division of Family & Children Services (DFCS) and the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA). D-SNAP will be run in four phases. Phase 2 will begin on Tuesday, Oct. 29, 2024, in South Georgia and will run through Monday, Nov. 4, 2024, excluding Sunday, Nov. 3, 2024. Future phases will include counties declared by the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) for Individual and Public Assistance at the time of disaster. 
D-SNAP provides temporary food assistance in the form of a one-time payment to low-to-moderate income households who lost income or sustained property damage following a disaster. To qualify for D-SNAP, Georgians must:

• Live or work in one of the counties declared by FEMA for Individual and Public Assistance at the time of the disaster
• Not currently receive food assistance through the regular SNAP program
• Have suffered a disaster-related loss to property or income, including incurring expenses related to the disaster
• Provide proof of identity for the head of household and authorized representative (if applicable)
• Meet financial eligibility requirements

Current SNAP recipients are not eligible for D-SNAP and should not apply.

Completing Pre-Registration for D-SNAP
Households who live or work in Phase 2 counties may pre-register only during their designated disaster benefit period and may be asked to provide additional proof to determine eligibility. Early pre-registration for Phase 2 households will begin on Saturday, Oct. 26, 2024, and end on Monday, Oct. 28, 2024. Pre-registration will continue through the duration of Phase 2. Paper applications will also be available at D-SNAP sites. 

The pre-registration form can be found on gateway.ga.gov. Applicants will need to create an account to pre-register. 

Households may pre-register with just their name, address, and signature at any point during pre-registration by clicking on the "Sign & Submit" button. However, DHS encourages applicants to answer as many questions as they can before submitting the pre-registration form. 

Households should be prepared to provide the following information: 

• Name, date of birth, and Social Security number (if applicable) for each household member
• Permanent residential address, temporary address, and/or mailing address
• Proof of identification, such as a driver's license or state-issued ID
• Amount of disaster-related expenses incurred during the disaster period
• Amount of income for each household member
• Amount of household resources, to include cash on hand or savings

Pre-registering for D-SNAP online is only the first step. Households must also complete an interview to determine their eligibility and finalize the D-SNAP application process. Households must be represented by either the head of household or an authorized representative.
 
Eligibility for the program requires an in-person or telephonic interview. Georgians must complete the in-person interview at a designated D-SNAP site, send an authorized representative to do so, or complete the interview over the phone. 

To pre-register and complete a telephonic interview, D-SNAP applicants who live or work in the Phase 2 counties can call 833-DSNAP-GA (833-376-2742) beginning Tuesday, Oct. 29, 2024. The D-SNAP Virtual Call Center will operate Monday through Saturday, 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. 

To manage call volume and in-person wait times, Phase 2 applicants are asked to call or visit a D-SNAP site location on the below assigned day based on their last name:
• Oct. 29, 2024: A-F
• Oct. 30, 2024: G-L
• Oct. 31, 2024: M-R
• Nov.1, 2024: S-Z 
• Nov. 2, 2024: Open to all Phase 2 applicants 
• Nov. 4, 2024: Open to all Phase 2 applicants

For more information on the program, visit dfcs.georgia.gov/d-snap.

post_body_text:
The Georgia Department of Human Services is beginning our Disaster SNAP (food stamps) efforts. D-SNAP provides temporary food assistance in the form of a one-time payment to low-to-moderate income households who lost income or sustained property damage following a disaster. Ware, Charleton, Brantley, Camden, Glynn, and McIntosh counties are a part of “Phase 2” which will begin Tuesday, October 29th . 

Site name:  Hours of operation: Dates: Address: Counties served:

Brantley, Camden, Charlton, Glynn, and McIntosh: Evergreen Missionary Baptist Church 8 a.m.-5 p.m. Oct. 29-Nov. 4, 2024 (excluding Nov. 3, 2024) 1365 Kinlaw Rd. Woodbine, GA 31569 

Atkinson, Bacon, Ben Hill, Clinch, Coffee, Irwin, Pierce, and Ware: 
Young’s Chapel Missionary Baptist Church 8 a.m.-5 p.m. Oct. 29-Nov. 4, 2024 (excluding Nov. 3, 2024) 710 Shirley Ave.
Douglas, GA 31533 

Press Release:
Georgia Implements Phase 2 of Disaster SNAP in Atkinson, Bacon, Ben Hill, Berrien, Brantley, Brooks, Camden, Charlton, Clinch, Coffee, Colquitt, Cook, Echols, Glynn, Irwin, Lanier, Lowndes, McIntosh, Pierce, Thomas, Tift, and Ware Counties

Affected Residents in These Counties may Pre-register Through D-SNAP Portal Beginning Oct. 26

Atlanta, GA – Georgians in areas hit hardest by Hurricane Helene can pre-register for assistance to feed their families under a temporary program called the Disaster Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (D-SNAP) supported by the Georgia Department of Human Services’ (DHS) Division of Family & Children Services (DFCS) and the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA). D-SNAP will be run in four phases. Phase 2 will begin on Tuesday, Oct. 29, 2024, in South Georgia and will run through Monday, Nov. 4, 2024, excluding Sunday, Nov. 3, 2024. Future phases will include counties declared by the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) for Individual and Public Assistance at the time of disaster. 
D-SNAP provides temporary food assistance in the form of a one-time payment to low-to-moderate income households who lost income or sustained property damage following a disaster. To qualify for D-SNAP, Georgians must:

• Live or work in one of the counties declared by FEMA for Individual and Public Assistance at the time of the disaster
• Not currently receive food assistance through the regular SNAP program
• Have suffered a disaster-related loss to property or income, including incurring expenses related to the disaster
• Provide proof of identity for the head of household and authorized representative (if applicable)
• Meet financial eligibility requirements

Current SNAP recipients are not eligible for D-SNAP and should not apply.

Completing Pre-Registration for D-SNAP
Households who live or work in Phase 2 counties may pre-register only during their designated disaster benefit period and may be asked to provide additional proof to determine eligibility. Early pre-registration for Phase 2 households will begin on Saturday, Oct. 26, 2024, and end on Monday, Oct. 28, 2024. Pre-registration will continue through the duration of Phase 2. Paper applications will also be available at D-SNAP sites. 

The pre-registration form can be found on gateway.ga.gov. Applicants will need to create an account to pre-register. 

Households may pre-register with just their name, address, and signature at any point during pre-registration by clicking on the "Sign & Submit" button. However, DHS encourages applicants to answer as many questions as they can before submitting the pre-registration form. 

Households should be prepared to provide the following information: 

• Name, date of birth, and Social Security number (if applicable) for each household member
• Permanent residential address, temporary address, and/or mailing address
• Proof of identification, such as a driver's license or state-issued ID
• Amount of disaster-related expenses incurred during the disaster period
• Amount of income for each household member
• Amount of household resources, to include cash on hand or savings

Pre-registering for D-SNAP online is only the first step. Households must also complete an interview to determine their eligibility and finalize the D-SNAP application process. Households must be represented by either the head of household or an authorized representative.
 
Eligibility for the program requires an in-person or telephonic interview. Georgians must complete the in-person interview at a designated D-SNAP site, send an authorized representative to do so, or complete the interview over the phone. 

To pre-register and complete a telephonic interview, D-SNAP applicants who live or work in the Phase 2 counties can call 833-DSNAP-GA (833-376-2742) beginning Tuesday, Oct. 29, 2024. The D-SNAP Virtual Call Center will operate Monday through Saturday, 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. 

To manage call volume and in-person wait times, Phase 2 applicants are asked to call or visit a D-SNAP site location on the below assigned day based on their last name:
• Oct. 29, 2024: A-F
• Oct. 30, 2024: G-L
• Oct. 31, 2024: M-R
• Nov.1, 2024: S-Z 
• Nov. 2, 2024: Open to all Phase 2 applicants 
• Nov. 4, 2024: Open to all Phase 2 applicants

For more information on the program, visit dfcs.georgia.gov/d-snap.

Georgia’s farmers are facing serious challenges in the wake of Hurricane Helene. To support them, Georgia Farm Bureau has teamed up with the Georgia Department of Agriculture and other ag organizations to create a relief fund. Farmers are the backbone of our economy, and their recovery is essential. Your contribution can make a real difference in helping them rebuild. Find out more and donate at www.SupportGeorgiaFarmers.org
GoogleAudioText: I'm George Agriculture Commissioner Tyler Harper and Hurricane Helene had a devastating impact to our agricultural industry across all aspects and every commodity in its path when it come through our state. And because of that, we join with 40 other organizations, ag organizations across our state to put together a Georgia Hurricane relief fund. A fund that 100% of the donations raised will go directly back to those farm families and those that were impacted by Hurricane Helene to help them get back on their feet. I want to encourage you to take an opportunity to donate to the Georgia Hurricane relief fund, our weathered but strong fund, that we're going to work to ensure that our farm families, our agricultural industry is able to get through this storm and be weathered as the tagline is be weathered but be stronger on the other side of it. I want you to join us in supporting that fund. I want you to join us in helping share that fund as we ensure that our number one industry and that agriculture continues to be successful every single day. Thank you for taking an opportunity to consider donating to the fund and we hope you'll join us in supporting our farm families across the great state of Georgia. God bless you.

Yesterday, I joined @POTUS and saw firsthand the impact that Hurricane Helene has had on communities in Florida and Georgia. https://t.co/V4PTp7r8hT

GEORGIA: Do you need help accessing resources after Hurricane Helene? 

Visit our Resource Guide to find step-by-step instructions for how to apply for FEMA Federal Emergency Management Agency Individual & Public Assistance, U.S. Small Business Administration loans, U.S. Department of Agriculture programs, and more below.

A couple of hurricane related updates:

Governor Brian Kemp has suspended the gas tax as of yesterday.  This will save you about .30 cents per gallon of gas and about .33 cents per gallon of diesel.

Both Cook and Colquitt are eligible for FEMA Individual Assistance and Public Assistance.  As far as individual assistance, in most cases, your insurance will be primary coverage and the individual assistance can cover any gaps.  Find more info at https://www.fema.gov/assistance/individual. It outlines eligibility and criteria.  There will likely be more information coming on this topic so please keep it on your radar screen.

While still determining Ag commodity damages locally and to the east of us, there are some things in the works from U.S. Department of Agriculture, Georgia Department of Agriculture, and other agencies.  Check with your local FSA offices for more information; most of it will be to the benefit of our growers and producers.  Appreciate the work of our Ag Commissioner Georgia Agriculture Commissioner Tyler Harper and Georgia Forestry Commission, and others in spotlighting the amount of unprecedented damage to our state's top industry.  There will likely be more updates on this at the state level in the near future as well.

There are still a good many of our citizens without power.  In the past on military deployments, I have lived for several weeks without power or running water but that was in a combat zone.  From what I have seen and heard, the conditions for our neighbors east of us are very similar.  I know from speaking to them directly that our utility companies are at the edge of their capabilities and are doing all they can to get power back. Updates are available at Colquitt Electric Membership Corporation, Georgia Power, and your city utility departments.

Thank you to all the private, non-profit, public, and neighbor to neighbor assistance that is going on, seen and unseen. It has been an inspiration to us. #Helene

Today, I met with federal, state, and local officials to receive an operational briefing around the needs of Florida communities in the wake of Hurricane Helene.
 
I also provided some updates of our own:

Yesterday, I approved 100% percent federal cost share for emergency response activities in Florida, Georgia, Tennessee and North Carolina. This will cover the costs for the urgent work to remove debris; surge additional first responders and search and rescue teams; set up shelters; and provide food and clean water.

U.S. Department of Agriculture is on the ground to support farmers, ranchers, and small businesses impacted by the storm. And FEMA Federal Emergency Management Agency is knocking doors to register folks to receive financial assistance.

To date, more than $20 million in Individual Assistance has been provided to thousands of survivors who have been affected by Hurricane Helene and FEMA has shipped over 9.3 million meals, more than 11.2 million liters of water, 150 generators and more than 260,000 tarps to the region.

The Georgia Department of Agriculture (GDA) said the state is suffering significant farming loss from the impact of Hurricane Helene.

🚨DAY 4 IN WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA 🚨 In the wake of Hurricane Helene, our RedRover Responders staff and volunteers have been assisting the N.C. Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services with animals displaced from the disaster. While at the WNC Ag Center, we cared for 29 animals alongside our friends at ifaw. Now, we're preparing the Salisbury State Operated Shelter at the J.F. Hurley Family YMCA in Salisbury, North Carolina, to receive and provide care to incoming animals. To support our emergency sheltering work, please give today: bit.ly/RedRoverHelene

#HurricaneHelene #Helene #Hurricane #GulfCoast #NorthCarolina #SouthCarolina #Georgia #Florida #RedRover

GCA has been busy today with water deliveries in the affected area today. Our Region VPs, Volunteers and Staff have been responding in conjunction with Georgia Department of Agriculture personnel on that front. 

GCA has also been in touch with our legislative delegation as well stressing the need for financial relief for our members with calls requesting that any relief that comes should be in the form of a block grant rather than other forms of relief so that cattle producers aren't left in the dark. Agricultural Commissioner Tyler Harper, Senate Ag Committee Chairman Russ Goodman and House Ag Committee Chairman Robert Dickey have also requested this type of relief in their letter on September 30th to Georgia's Congressional Delegation. 

GCA has also been in contact with other state cattlemen's associations discussing donated supplies and work crews that are wanting to come in. GCA is aggregating the supplies now and will be assigning work crews as needed. If you are needing fencing supplies, please complete this form https://forms.gle/sFTs4qC7rPGirJc27 so we can coordinate the needs with available help. Please note that we can't make our members whole, but we can help them patch things up so they can sleep at night. 

If you are not affected by the storm, but want to help, please go through your stash of fence materials and if you have any t-posts, wood posts, barbed wire, staples or clips that you can spare, please drop those off this week to the locations below. Please note that whatever you want to donate we cannot guarantee that you'll get back (generators, equipment, tools, etc).

A post we hoped we would never have to make..... 

When Hurricane Helene came through, she decided she liked Moses Pecans and took them with her. We are at a 80% total tree loss across all orchards. Our younger (10 and under) orchards seemed to weather the storm better and that is our 20% left but as we all know they will not produce for another few years. 

But on a much brighter note, Commissioner Tyler Harper is the definition of boots on the ground, "What can we do?". He visited the farm today to help assess damage and start advocating for farmers in our area. We can't thank him enough, in a time like this it means a lot to see him out doing everything he can.  And in the words of Governor Kemp, all we can do now is "Keep Plowing".

Georgia Agriculture Commissioner Tyler Harper
Georgia Department of Agriculture
Georgia Pecan Growers Association, Inc
 #HurricaneHelene #georgiapecans #gpga #mosespecan

The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) Farm Service Agency (FSA) reminds producers impacted by Hurricane Helene that FSA has programs and resources available to provide assistance in recovery efforts. USDA staff in Georgia stand ready and are eager to assist our state’s producers in the aftermath of this storm.

It is critical that producers keep accurate records to document damage or loss (take pictures, count trees, etc.) and report losses and damage to your local USDA Service Center as soon as possible.

Additionally, due to long-standing federal law, producers should not perform any clean-up efforts until an environmental evaluation has been completed by your local county office unless there is an immediate threat to human life. Failure to comply could jeopardize a producer's payment eligibility. Debris removal is permitted as long as there is no ground disturbance.

Find the USDA’s Hurricane Helene Recovery Resources memo below:
